scrape.title: The dinner
scrape.author: John
scrape.text:
The nerviest, most expertly crafted novel of suspense I've ever read. It starts as an awkward comedy of manners, hinting at some deeper tragedy. But you're sucked in so gradually to a world of terror - with a thin film of civility on top - that you end the book in near shock.
Recommended for anyone who wants to write slow, expert suspense. Read it with Post-It notes and a highlighter.
